headline: Grand Theft Auto VI delayed until 2026, extending wait for highly anticipated game | CBC News
context: Take-Two Interactive on Friday pushed the release of Grand Theft Auto VI to May 26, 2026, extending the wait for the most hotly anticipated title in video-gaming history and sending its shares tumbling 9 per cent in pre-market trading.

annotations.paragraph: Take-Two Interactive on Friday pushed the release of Grand Theft Auto VI to May 26, 2026, extending the wait for one of the most hotly anticipated titles in video-gaming history and sending its shares tumbling nine per cent in pre-market trading.
annotations.reason: This paragraph repeats the information provided in the context.

annotations.paragraph: The title, developed by Rockstar Games, was previously slated for a fall 2025 launch. The franchise is the crown jewel in Take-Two's portfolio, accounting for a significant share of revenue and player engagement, and expectations for the upcoming title have been baked into Wall Street forecasts for months.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides context about the game's development timeline and its importance to Take-Two's financials.

annotations.paragraph: The game is expected to be an instant hit, with billions of dollars in sales each year, according to several analysts. The previous entry, Grand Theft Auto V, released in 2013, has sold more than 200 million copies, making it one of the best-selling video games of all time.
annotations.reason: This paragraph offers context on the expected success of the game and historical sales data.

annotations.paragraph: "We support fully Rockstar Games taking additional time to realize their creative vision for Grand Theft Auto VI, which promises to be a groundbreaking blockbuster entertainment experience," Take-Two CEO Strauss Zelnick said.

annotations.paragraph: Delays have become commonplace in modern game development as studios grapple with rising production costs and growing pressure from players to deliver polished experiences at launch.
